intro: Cyrtandra hiranoi, commonly known as the Hana Mountain Cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It is often found growing in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Cyrtandra hiranoi is considered a rare and endangered species.
